title: King Kong
content:
[img]http://www.kingkongmovie.com/images/index_01.jpg[/img]
The remake of the 1933 classic is almost ready for release. This image says it all, the 14th available in the cinema near you.
King Kong is the story of a giant monkey who ruins a big city fight with a tyrannosaurs and marries a beautiful woman and more of this kind of great plot details.
Silly, bubble gum for the brain? Maybe but with Peter Jackson, the man behind Lord of the rings, as director this movie will surely be a beauty. Sin City already proved that a movie can stand on it's look alone and I'm sure that King Kong will be fun as well.

Who's going?
[url=http://www.kingkongmovie.com/]Official website[/url]-----------------
[img]http://jamba.nl/storage/view/335/0/cr/CrazyFrog___Axel_F_Rocket.gif[/img]

title: Re: Re: King Kong
content:
No, I just said those because it's easy to understand even for the mentally less skilled. I won't say it's you.

The movies were long without some happenings that were important in the books and with emphasis on unimportant things, like love scenes. Some (not love) scenes were good, but they were only good in themselves, not as part of the movie. And the movie had no message, it wasn't even entertaining for me. The special effects were nice though... Maybe this is something the masses want.

He is a really good director if the income of a movie makes a director good.

The problem with this is that average movies make money, even if no-one likes them as much as they would like good ones, and it's easier to sell them for the masses than good movies that only less people like.

What does good mean then? It depends on your personal taste, and everyone has different taste. This is why average movies can't be really good, only goodish.[hr]The human brain is not user-friendly...

title: Kong
content:
As for the above spoiler part... Who cares!
Seriously, I personally couldn't care about it, in my opinion that was really unimportant.

I like the movie, but it wasn't perfect.
It felt sort of... hollow, the characters didn't really have much meaning to me.
Of course Kong and Ann were the major characters, and those were developed at least.
Anyway, nice scenery in there, but... somehow it didn't feel as epic as LOTR, and it's not just the smaller scale, it's the way things appeared, somehow.
I'm not sure if the CGI team is the same though, could be completely different.

This is all sounding pretty negative; I did like seeing it. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

title: Re: Kong
content:
Jack Black's character is a dumbass.

Question 1: If you find a lost island and have one chance to bring back a specimen of its fauna to civilisation, do you take:
a) A DINOSAUR!!!!!!
b) A GIANT INSECT!!!!!
c) a really really big monkey.


If you chose option c) then YOU ARE A DUMBASS!!!!!!! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-furious.gif[/img] ----------
